title: Actress Leah Bracknell was a mould-breaker for British soaps, playing the first regular lesbian character, who also suffered from mental illness
text:
Former Emmerdale actress Leah Bracknell, who has died aged 55, three years after a diagnosis of stage 4 lung cancer, was a leader in the portrayal of LGBT characters in soap opera. Her character Zoe Tate, who she played from 1989 - 2005, was the first permanent lesbian character in a British soap.

John Whiston, Managing Director of Continuing Drama and Head of ITV in the North, said: "Everyone on Emmerdale is very sad to hear of the death of Leah Bracknell. Leah was a hugely popular member of the Emmerdale cast for over 16 years. During that time she featured in some of the show's most high profile and explosive plots and always delivered a pitch perfect performance. Zoe Tate was one of soap's...
description: Former Emmerdale actress Leah Bracknell, who has died aged 55, three years after a diagnosis of stage 4 lung cancer, was a leader in the portrayal of LGBT characters in soap opera.
